item.title: Welcome To Blobim.com
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: This Site will hold a wide Wiki section spilling information about, Video/Projection Mapping, how to compose , edit, program and perform mapping projects. Multi-Touch and Interactive sensors (infra, laser, sens you name it). While some Programming skills are needed Python, C++ and PureData tutorials will be presented. Programming create Software so, from time to time I’ll release some of my Software and Forks including access to the Source Code on my Github . While Hardware is Inevitable accessory at this game. Keep Cool and Handle It! Gil@d Levi

item.title: Video Mapping
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: [mbYTPlayer url="http://youtu.be/lX6JcybgDFo" opacity="1" quality="hd1080" ratio="16/9" isinline="false" showcontrols="true" realfullscreen="false" printurl="false" autoplay="true" startat="30" mute="true" loop="true" addraster="false" stopmovieonblur="false" gaTrack="false"] This section is all about video/projection mapping. Box explores the synthesis of real and digital space through projection-mapping on moving surfaces. The short film documents a live performance, captured entirely in camera. Bot & Dolly produced this work to serve as both an artistic statement and technical demonstration. It is the culmination of multiple technologies, including large scale robotics, projection mapping, and software engineering. We believe this methodology has tremendous potential to radically transform theatrical presentations, and define new genres of expression. Find out exactly how "Box" was created in our exclusive behind the scenes video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?list=PL6... http://www.botndolly.com/box _______________________________ Subscribe to The Creators Project: http://bit.ly/Subscribe_to_TheCreator...

item.title: LPMTX Video mapping tool
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: LPMTX is a Professional Video Software originally forked from hva LPMT aimed specially to Video/Projection Mapping  installations. With LPMTX  new functions and  RemoteX Controller  it can also use for VJ 's as a Video Mixer controlled by OSC , Midi or TUIO protocols. The software best results is with the new reconfigured completable hardware  The VPM Server, The server is customizable I/O Machine starts with HD/SDI 4in 4out standard and can be set up to 16in 36out with customized  standards as DVI/SDI/HDMI Play and Capture connectors. The VPM Server is equipped With 2 CPU's 32gb RAM and high end storage on its minimum to mid level standards and can be set up to 4 CPU's 128gb RAM fast as fire  storage for maximum high level performance requirement and can play  simultaneously 36 video outputs at 4K quality. The origenal LPMT was alredy equiped with Shiffman's MPE (most pixels ever) multi output sync  .MPE is a server/clients relation sync protocol for multi video channels and an easy projection/video-wall mode  tool that holds your output at the highest resolution presented. LPMTX Source code (if you can compile it you can use it) MPE -  Source code [repo owner="giladx" name="lpmtX"] Gil@dLevi

item.title: FFMPEG the mother of encode decode Media
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
FFmpeg is a leading multimedia framework. It is able to decode, encode, transcode, mux, demux, stream, filter and play pretty much anything that humans and machines have created. FFMPEG supports the most obscure ancient formats up to the cutting edge. FFMPEG contains libavcodec, libavutil, libavformat, libavfilter, libavdevice, libswscale and libswresample which can be used by applications. It is also can formed as ffmpeg, ffserver, ffplay and ffprobe which can be used by end users for transcoding, streaming and playing.

FFMPEG as is is a command line tool delivered as an official package for multiple Linux distributions and have some separate GUI projects For Mac OS X and MS Windows as well.

WINFF - Provide binary for  Linux and MS Windows.

FFMPEGX - Provide binary for Mac OS X

Enjoy Gil@d Levi

item.title: Multiprojection with Puredata
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Puredata is The open-source alternative to Max/Msp  for UNIX like operating systems, it is multi-platform very versatile visual programming language. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=D9YdySz-CwM Mandril Boxes Gil@dlevi

item.title: Lives video editor & live vj tool
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: LiVES mixes realtime video performance and non-linear editing in one professional quality application. It will let you start editing and making video right away, without having to worry about formats, frame sizes, or framerates. It is a very flexible tool which is used by both professional VJ’s and video editors – mix and switch clips from the keyboard, use dozens of realtime effects, trim and edit your clips in the clip editor, and bring them together using the multitrack timeline. You can even record your performance in real time, and then edit it further or render it straight away. LiVES is easy to compile and on many linux distro. its in the repository. Gil@dLevi

item.content:encoded: Kdenlive is a powerful multi-track video editor, including most recent video technologies. This software is completely free, as defined by the GNU foundation. Using Kdenlive is investing in a community driven project, which aims to establish relationships between people in order to built the best video tools. Kdenlive downloads is available for Multiple Linux Distros, Unix(FreeBSD) and Mac OS X. check this out too —>> ;) <<– yes, it’s a link. and here is some great tutorials to start with. ; compile it .. enjoy Gil@dLevi

item.title: Extended View
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Extended View evolved around the idea to create a low-cost solution to create panoramic media. The main goal was to create a simple and accessible system, which provides everyone with the possibility to experiment with that wider angle of vision and to explore the challenges and chances that lie in this format. Furthermore Extended View Toolkit serves as a multi-plattform solution for projection-mapping with scene-based control and automation features. Extended View Toolkit is based on the open source dataflow programming environment PUREDATA and its GEM extension. It is a set of abstractions for combining multiple video or image sources into a panoramic image and for projection setups with mutliple projectors or projection environments with challenging geometric forms. Multiple input media (e.g. camera input, video files, image files, 3D renderings) can be processed. It is possible to create imagery or video by either stitching multiple inputs to one continuous, or by unwrapping a 360-degree image taken with a special optical lens system. Such processed media input can then be projected onto even irregular shaped surfaces. It is possible to blend smoothly between multiple projectors, to create seamless immersive media environments. http://extendedview.mur.at/
